intro: Nycterinia pumila, commonly known as the small nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale purple, often blooming at night. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Nycterinia pumila is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
